alert.note: Alert for Greer; Kiowa; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 17 at 11:46PM CDT until June 18 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and western Oklahoma, including the following counties, in southwest Oklahoma, Greer, Harmon and Kiowa. In western Oklahoma, Washita. * WHEN...Until 245 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1146 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hobart, Mangum, Granite, Sentinel, Mountain View, Lone Wolf, Gotebo, Rocky, Willow, Vinson, Altus-Lugert Lake and Brinkman. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
